definition: to sympathize/to pity/to feel compassion for

sentences.english: I would like to end by thanking God for the small mercies he has shown us at this dreadful time.
sentences.chinese: 感謝上帝在這個可怕的時代向我們顯露的悲憫。

sentences.english: He saw the water was almost gone. His heart filled with mercy.
sentences.chinese: 他看到水差不多沒了，心裏充滿了悲憫。

sentences.english: One should deal with everything in the world with a compassionate bosom.
sentences.chinese: 你擁有一顆悲憫的情懷於萬事萬物。

sentences.english: In his work, he expresses his sympathy for nobodies.
sentences.chinese: 他在作品中表達了對小人物的悲憫之情。

sentences.english: She seeps her grief to them in the air of scholarly refinementbetween the lines.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己對他們的悲憫滲透在書卷氣的字裏行間。

sentences.english: Leo is the most caring and chivalrous person you could ever come across.
sentences.chinese: 獅子座可能是你遇到過的最有悲憫俠義之風的人。

definition: a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
separated in life and death/to part for ever
